alert.note: Alert for Barbour; Doddridge; Gilmer; Harrison; Lewis; Northwest Randolph; Ritchie; Taylor; Upshur (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 27 at 8:18PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A line of strong thunderstorms impacting portions of northwestern Randolph, southeastern Ritchie, southern Doddridge, southern Taylor, northeastern Gilmer, Lewis, northern Upshur, Barbour and southern Harrison Counties through 845 PM EST... At 818 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Newburg to 11 miles west of Jackson Mill. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Clarksburg, Elkins, Buckhannon, Grafton, Weston, Philippi, Audra State Park, Bridgeport, Belington, Stonewood, Nutter Fort, Anmoore, Jackson Mill, Stonewall Jackson, West Milford, Junior, Lost Creek, Jane Lew, Flemington and Womelsdorf (Coalton). This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 91 and 119. Route 50 in West Virginia between mile markers 80 and 82. Route 33 between mile markers 1 and 35. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Barbour; Doddridge; Gilmer; Harrison; Lewis; Northwest Randolph; Ritchie; Taylor; Upshur
